content.webTitle: Chris Joynt faces tests after second collapse

fields.headline: Joynt faces tests after collapse
fields.bodyText: The St Helens captain Chris Joynt will have tests this week after collapsing for the second time this season in the dressing room before the game against London Broncos at Griffin Park on Sunday. "It was totally different from last time, but something we've got to get sorted out," said Joynt, who also collapsed in the Lancashire team hotel before the second Origin match against Yorkshire in June. "They're saying it was an allergic reaction to some mouthwash I had after cutting my lip, but nobody really knows yet. The worry is that every time it happens, the reaction is worse. If it wasn't for our medical people, I could have lost my life." Joynt, 32, is angry at suggestions made on Sky Sports on Sunday that he had collapsed after having a painkilling injection. "I can honestly state I have never had a painkilling injection in order to play a game of rugby league," Joynt said.
